title: mastectomy_scar
body:
A type of [[scar on chest|chest scar]].

These scars tend to come in symmetrically placed pairs, placed on lower chest, right below pectorals. They are sometimes slightly curved upwards.

They are associated with [[mastectomy]] (colloquially referred to as "top surgery" in LGBT circles) - a procedure that removes a person's breasts. Common for transgender men, for whom it is used to achieve a more masculine appearance, but it is also used for breast cancer or gynecomastia patients.

h4. See also
* [[chest binder]]
* [[transgender flag]]
* [[lgbt pride]]
* [[gender transitioning]]
* [[cuntboy]]

title: conductor_(ginga_tetsudou_999)
body:
[b]Conductor[/b] ([i]Sashou-san[/i]) is one of the main characters of the [[Ginga Tetsudou 999]] ([i]Galaxy Express 999[/i]) [[science fiction]] series from the 70s created by [[Matsumoto Leiji]]. He is voiced by the late [[Kimotsuki Kaneta]].

Conductor is the main crew member of the [[three-nine_(space_train)|Galaxy Express 999]] [[spacecraft]]. He is a short [[alien]] being with an invisible body thus only his eyes can be seen while he is wearing his [[train conductor]] uniform. 

His character design is somewhat similar to the [[Jawa]]s from [[Star Wars]], [[Orko]] from [[Masters of the Universe]] and [[Vivi Ornitier]] from [[Final Fantasy IX]].

title: korean_war
body:
The [b]Korean War[/b] was a war between [[North Korea]] (with the support of [[China]] and the [[Soviet Union]]) and [[South Korea]] (with the support of the [[United Nations]], principally from the [[United states|United States]]). The war began on 25 June 1950 with the North Korean invasion of South Korea following clashes along the border and insurrections in the south.  The war ended unofficially on 27 July 1953 in an armistice and the creation of the Korean Demilitarized Zone.

It is considered one of the first conflicts of the [[Cold War]] era.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia - Korean War":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War]

title: houppelande
body:
An outer garment worn by men and women in the late middle ages, originating in France. It's long, full body with flaring sleeves, sometimes lined with [[fur]]. The edges are often dagged, or cut into decorative patterns such as scallops, "embattled" tabs or even leaf shapes. Traditionally, the women's is always floor-length, while men's could be of any length. 

In England, it was mockingly called a [i]goun[/i]. In Italy, it was called a [i]pellanda[/i]. The garment has survived as academic and legal robes of today.

h4. See also
* [[herigaut]]
* [[coat]]
* [[housecoat]]


h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Houppelande":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houppelande

title: weapon_case
body:
A type of portable case designed to safely store, carry and transport [[weapon]]s (including the accessories) in concealed manner. It comes in various colours and shape, though rectangular is the most common one - as well as being made from various material (e.g. fabric, leather, or plastic).
Weapon case can be carried on back just like [[backpack]] (post #5190996), or being handheld like a [[briefcase]] (post #3566073). It can be soft or rigid container (post #5334885). Some designs feature internal foam pad for extra protection (see post #3702122). 

This type of bag can also take shape as an [[instrument case]] (see post #5947317 or post #3958907).

h4. See also

* [[chest rig]]
* [[holster]]

title: keeper_of_the_bell_(hilda)
body:
A minor character from the cartoon series [[Hilda (series)|]]. He's a member of the Trolberg Safety Patrol responsible for sounding the big troll bells installed in Trolberg to alarm the citizens about trolls and to chase off these trolls, as the sound of bells is painful or at the very least unpleasant for them.
According to popular fan theories, he was purportedly the lost father of the main character [[Hilda (Hilda)|]], but at least in the cartoon series and its novelizations, that theory was contradicted by the introduction of [[Anders (Hilda)|]], father of Hilda and former partner of [[Johanna (Hilda)|]] (the exact nature of their relationship, i.e. whether they were married or not and how close they were besides having sex at least one time, wasn't revealed as of now).

title: demonophobia
body: Demonophobia is a [[Guro]] survival horror game made in 2008 by an anonymous creator named [[madowaku|237]]. It follows [[Kunikai Sakuri]] as she finds herself in Hell following the foolish use of an occult tome in a bid to take revenge upon her bullies from school, and focuses on her efforts to escape from Hell and the often horrific suffering that she goes through in the process. Along the way, she meets the only friendly demon in the game, [[Ritz_(demonophobia)|]], who acts as her guide.

title: kachimakuri_motemakuri_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a 1999 magazine ad for an "Emil Holder", a key holder that supposedly brings the owner good luck. The ad involves a man taking a [[money bath]] with two women by his side, the man holding the aforementioned key holder and all three of them holding stacks of money, captioned with various promises of good fortune, "勝ちまくり モテまくり", which can be translated as "Get all the money! Get all the girls!", being the one that caught on the most.

title: iei
body:
An iei is a [[portrait (object)|portrait]] [[photo (object)|photo]] of a deceased person. Commonly seen in scenes during, before, or after Japanese [[funeral|funerals]], either on display or carried by a family member. They are distinguishable by their frames, which are typically wrapped on both the left and right top corners - often with a bow in the center.

title: katsuragi_kai_(kancolle)
body:
[[Katsuragi (Kancolle)|]]'s Kai/remodeled form. See post #1997016.

In her kai form, she disposes of the kimono entirely, and wears a [[pleated skirt]], [[uneven gloves|asymmetric]] [[fingerless gloves]], with one being [[elbow_gloves|an elbow glove]], and [[black thighhighs]] to create [[zettai ryouiki]].  Her armor also includes an armored belt and both forms show off her [[midriff]]. Like [[amagi (kancolle)|Amagi]] her green [[furisode]] reflects the fact that she spent almost her entire service camouflaged. 

Her quiver in kai form has paper-charm-like arrowheads on her [[arrow (projectile)|]]s, turning her into a hybrid of the two prevalent CV styles in the game (shikigami-base and archery-base). Also in kai form, a [[flight deck]] is suspended off of the left of the rear of her armored belt, along with a mockup of her bridge and several AA turrets as a counterbalance on her right.

title: condensation
body:
Small drops of [[water]] that accumulate on surfaces colder than the surrounding air, such as on cold [[drinking_glass|drinking glasses]]. [[dew drop|Dew]] is a form of condensation usually found mornings after objects drop in temperature overnight. In freezing temperatures, condensation may take the form of [[frost]].

Condensation on glass surfaces such as [[window|windows]] and [[mirror|mirrors]] may produce a [[window fog]] effect (post #1579162). See the [[glass writing]] tag for text and symbols made on fogged glass with one's finger. 

Please don't confuse the appearance of condensation on glass with [[frosted glass]], where the glass itself is created to have a foggy appearance.

Contrast the condensation found on solid objects with various types of airborne water droplets:

* [[breath]]
* [[cloud]]
* [[contrail|contrail]]
* [[fog]] / mist
* [[steam]]

title: omni-man
body:
[b]Omni-Man[/b], known by his civilian alias Nolan Grayson, is the secondary character [spoiler]and the main antagonist[/spoiler] of the comic and cartoon series [[Invincible (series)|Invincible]].

Dubbed "the greatest superhero of Earth", Omni-Man is a humanoid alien of a race known as Vitrumites that was sent to protect the Earth from would-be invaders. He married a human named Debbie, who gave birth to his son [[Mark Grayson|Mark]]. [spoiler]In reality, he was sent by the expansionist and brutal Vitrum Empire to conquer Earth.[/spoiler]

He is voiced by J.K. Simmons.

title: merry_christmas_mr._lawrence
body:
[b]Merry Christmas, Mr. Lawrence[/b] (Japanese: 戦場のメリークリスマス, Hepburn: [i]Senjō no Merī Kurisumasu[/i], lit. [b]Merry Christmas on the Battlefield[/b]), also known as [b]Furyo[/b] (Japanese for "[[prisoner]] of war"), is a 1983 war film co-written and directed by Ōshima Nagisa, co-written by Paul Mayersberg, and produced by Jeremy Thomas. 

The film is based on the experiences of Sir Laurens van der Post (portrayed by "Tom Conti":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Conti) as a prisoner of war of [[Japan]] during [[World War II]], as depicted in his books "The Seed and the Sower" (1963) and "The Night of the New Moon" (1970). It stars late musician and actor [[David Bowie]] (as [[Maj. Jack Strafer Celliers]]), the late composer and actor "Sakamoto Ryuichi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryuichi_Sakamoto (as [[Capt. Yonoi]]), [[Kitano Takeshi]] and Jack Thompson; Sakamoto also wrote the score including the vocal version of the main theme "Forbidden Colours":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jsG2M66-_xc, with lyrics written and sung by David Sylvian.

The film was entered into the 1983 Cannes Film Festival in competition for the Palme d'Or. Sakamoto's score won the film a BAFTA Award for Best Film Music that year.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Merry_Christmas,_Mr._Lawrence
other_names: 戦場のメリークリスマス

title: jagdpanzer_iv
body:
The [b]Jagdpanzer IV[/b], or [b]Sd.Kfz. 162[/b], was a German [[World War II]] [[tank destroyer]] based on the [b][[panzer_iv|Panzerkampfwagen IV]][/b] chassis and built in three main variants.  

The Jagdpanzer IV was made to replace the [[sturmgeschutz_iii|Stug III]] as the war progressed. But there were arguments they there was a waste of Panzer IV chassis since Stug IIIs could preform their task more than adequately. Either way the Jagdpanzer IV was still produced, a total of around 2,000 of them were manufactured in total.

title: dra-c

A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 0083]] OVA series from 1991.

[b]MS-21C Dra-C[/b]

A [[space]] exclusive use [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the Delaz Fleet of [[Zeon]] remnants. While at a glance it might look like a high spec custom space MS, it's actually an amalgam of parts from a [[Zaku II F2]] and a [[starfighter]]-bomber, with terrible mobility, inflexible armament, improvisations everywhere and incapable of AMBAC, even. It is however very fast in a straight line and has many [[vernier thrusters]].

body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] introduced in Book VII, who is a Goddess from Vanaheimr who bestows a revelation on [[kiran (Fire emblem)|the Summoner]] of [[Gullveig (Fire Emblem)|]]'s ruinous future. Like [[Fjorm (Fire Emblem)|]], she is strongly implied to have romantic feelings for the summoner. She also has a poor sense of direction and often gets lost.

She is particularly notorious for asking the summoner to "make a child" with her.

[spoilers]Seidr is also the person who eventually becomes Gullveig, and [[Kvasir (Fire Emblem)|]] is her past self.[/spoilers]

title: foo_fighters_(stand)
body:
Identically-named [[Stand (jojo)|]] power of [[Foo Fighters (jojo)|]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. A group of plankton given consciousness by the effects of [[Enrico Pucci]]'s Stand [[Whitesnake (stand)|]]. 

The plankton form into an unnatural humanoid shape in its original form, and are able to shoot sections of itself off from its finger like a gun. Can separate and move extremely fast when submerged in water.

Please note that this tag is for instances where the original "inhuman" form appear and/or when [[Foo Fighters (jojo)|]] is using her "[[finger gun]]". Example: post #132883

Namesake is the American alternative rock band Foo Fighters.

title: foo_fighters_(jojo)
body:
A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 6. A group of plankton given sentience by the effects of [[Enrico Pucci]]'s Stand [[Whitesnake (stand)|]]. The plankton possess the body of a dead female prison inmate and are capable of speech. Foo Fighters is essentially a [[Stand (jojo)|]], but is described as something closer to a new species.

In her human body, Foo Fighters requires constant hydration to sustain the plankton living inside. As such, she is almost always holding a drink cup when not near a water source.

Her name is frequently shortened to just "F.F".

h4. See also

* [[Foo Fighters (Stand)]]

title: shorts_under_skirt
body:
A pair of [[shorts]] worn beneath a [[skirt]] or [[dress]].

This is is how girls' school uniforms in Japan nowadays are most commonly worn. Usually it's either the above knee-length [[gym shorts]] from the school's P.E. suit (e.g. post #6560334), or much [[short shorts|shorter sports shorts]] such as [[dolphin shorts]] (e.g. post #6560191), though the former long-legged type typically only among middle school students, as high school girls prefer shorts that can't accidentally show even with [[miniskirt|short skirt]] lengths.
Wearing gym/sports shorts under skirts became popularized because it simplifies changing clothes between physical classes/activities, among other things. Despite this, [[pantyshot|pantyshots]] may still happen, due to [[panties under pantyhose|tights commonly being worn]] in lieu of shorts.

Because of this, it's also becoming more and more common to see this reflected in anime and manga, being often depicted as the default among school girls in series with a "grounded" premise such as [[Hori-san to Miyamura-kun|Horimiya]], [[Karakai Jouzu no Takagi-san|Takagi-san]], or [[Asobi Asobase]].

[[Bike shorts under skirt]] are a more tomboyish variant of this.

h4.See also
* [[shorts under dress]]
* [[bike shorts under skirt]]
* [[upskirt]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: hot_fuzz
body:
A 2007 British police action-comedy directed by Edgar Wright starring [[Simon Pegg]] & [[Nick Frost]] and written by Wright and Pegg as part of their [i]Three Flavours Cornetto[/i] trilogy ([i][[Shaun of The Dead]][/i] (2004), [i]Hot Fuzz[/i] (2007), and [i]The World's End[/i] (2013)).

It follows the story of [[Metropolitan Police Service]] Sergeant Nicholas Angel (Simon Pegg) - a meticulously good police officer - as he is transferred from [[London]] to the small [[village]] of Sandford, and as he works with his quite-incompetent partner, Danny Butterman (Nick Frost), who loves cop movies. While Sandford appears to be a quaint, peaceful village, it turns out that it's being controlled by a cult-like group, which he and the rest of the village's small (and also pretty incompetent) police force must take down.

h4. External links
* "IMDB":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0425112/]

body:
Small [[branch]] like objects that emit a golden glow introduced in [[Limbus Company]] that have various mysterious properties

In [[Limbus Company]], the Sinners are tasked by the titular company with the retrieval of the Golden Boughs from ruined [[Lobotomy Corporation]] facilities. 

The name of the Golden Boughs is taken from a tale of the same name from the "Aeneid":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aeneid written by ancient Roman poet "Publius Vergilius Maro":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virgil.

title: ear_tufts
body:
For tagging purposes this tag is for fur/hair at the tip of the ear that extends out notably beyond the tip of the ear, especially on some types of [[animal ears]].  Also known as [i]lynx tipping[/i], as this type of feature is most common and notably for felines from the genus Lynx.  Wild cats such as the caracal and domestic cats such as the Maine Coon also have ear tufts.  This tag is not limited to just cat ears.

There should be a visible difference from the ear tufts and the ear tips when using this tag, as some ears will have long narrow ear tips.

For bird ear tufts see the [[bird ears]] tag.  For ear furnishing, long hairs that grow from the inner ear and often confused with ear tufts, see the [[animal ear fluff]] tag.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ear tuft":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ear_tuft]

title: vocamente_yuuko
body:
Vocamente Yuuko is a character in [[Heybot!]]. She is an alternate persona of [[Nejiyanagi Yuuko]] and a continuation of [[Furuido Yuuko]].  Like Furuido, she has [[black hair]] that [[one_eye_covered|covers one eye]] styled as a [[short_hair|short]] [[bob cut]], but is no longer monochrome. Like Nejiyanagi, she has [[green eyes]].  She is often depicted with a [[blush]]. Originally designed as the protagonist's childhood friend in high school, she wears a [[school uniform]] with a [[purple_skirt|purple]] [[skirt]], [[purple_jacket|purple]] [[blazer]], [[green necktie]], [[white_shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[brown_footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. For some reason, she now lives in the series' version of [[hell]] and speaks in a faux broken Italian accent.

She also has a second form as a taller, older-looking teacher/demon-like character.  In this form she has [[long hair]] and wears a [[blue skirt]], [[pantyhose]], [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]], [[rimless_eyewear|rimless]] cats-eye [[glasses]], and a [[red_hairband|red]] [[demon_horns|demon horn]] [[hairband]]. She retains the white dress shirt.

title: drive_(movie)
body:
[b]Drive[/b] is a 2011 action drama film directed by Nicolas Winding Refn. 

In the film, [[Ryan Gosling]] portrays an [[driver (drive)|unnamed Hollywood stunt driver]] who also serves as a getaway driver for criminals. His life takes a significant turn when he develops a close bond with Irene, his neighbor, and her son, Benicio. When her debt-ridden husband, Standard, is released from prison, the two men take part in what turns out to be a botched million-dollar heist that endangers the lives of everyone involved.

Praised for its stylish direction, Gosling's performance, and a unique mix of action, suspense, and atmospheric storytelling, the film is celebrated for its striking cinematography and a synth-heavy soundtrack. 

The film has since garnered a devoted fanbase and achieved a cult following, partly due to its portrayal of Gosling's character as a stoic, mysterious, and pent-up figure. 

h4. See Also
* [[goslingposting (meme)|]]
* [[driver (drive) (cosplay)]]

h4. External Link

Usually depicted as a young woman with [[blue_hair|blue-ish]], [[medium_hair|medium length]] hair, [[multicolored_eyes|multicolored]] [[blue_eyes|blue]] and [[purple_eyes|purple]] eyes, [[white_wings|white]], [[feathered_wings|feathered wings]] and a [[halo]].

She mostly wears a [[white_dress|white dress]] with a [[cleavage_cutout|cleavage cutout]], [[hip_vent|hip vents]], with [[short_sleeves|short sleeves]] that [[bare_shoulders|expose her shoulders]].

body:
One of the yakuman (highest-scoring) hands in [[mahjong]]. Also known as "Nine gates".
Defined as a hand that contains tiles of the same suit forming the sequence 1112345678999, plus one additional tile of the same suit.

title: paradox_pokemon
body:
A type of [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] introduced in [[pokemon_sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]].

These Pokémon are believed to be from either the distant past or distant future. Most of them arrived in Area Zero in Paldea through a time machine; Pokémon Scarlet features Ancient Paradox Pokémon, whereas Pokémon Violet instead features Future Paradox Pokémon.

h5. Ancient Paradox Pokémon:
* [[Great Tusk|]] ([[Donphan]])
* [[Scream Tail|]] ([[Jigglypuff]])
* [[Brute Bonnet|]] ([[Amoonguss]])
* [[Flutter Mane|]] ([[Misdreavus]])
* [[Slither Wing|]] ([[Volcarona]])
* [[Sandy Shocks|]] ([[Magneton]])
* [[Roaring Moon|]] ([[Mega Salamence]])
* [[Koraidon|Winged King/Koraidon]] ([[Cyclizar]])
* [[Walking Wake]] ([[Suicune]])
* [[Raging Bolt]] ([[Raikou]])
* [[Gouging Fire]] ([[Entei]])

h5. Future Paradox Pokémon:
* [[Iron Treads|]] ([[Donphan]])
* [[Iron Bundle|]] ([[Delibird]])
* [[Iron Hands (pokemon)|]] ([[Hariyama]])
* [[Iron Jugulis|]] ([[Hydreigon]])
* [[Iron Moth|]] ([[Volcarona]])
* [[Iron Thorns|]] ([[Tyranitar]])
* [[Iron Valiant|]] ([[Mega Gardevoir]] & [[Mega Gallade]])
* [[Miraidon|Iron Serpent/Miraidon]] ([[Cyclizar]])
* [[Iron Leaves]] ([[Virizion]])
* [[Iron Crown]] ([[Cobalion]])
* [[Iron Boulder]] ([[Terrakion]]) 

"Bulbapedia":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Paradox_Pok%C3%A9mon
other_names: パラドックスポケモン

title: queadluun-nona
body:
[[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace [[alien]] [[power armor]] that first appeared in [i][b]The Super Dimension Fortress [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]][/b][/i] [[science fiction]] mecha anime [[video game]] for the [[Sega Saturn]] in 1997.

The [b]Queadluun-Nona[/b] is a simplified and cheaper mass-production model of the Queadluun-Rau designed to be usable by any [[maclone]] Zentradi or [[Meltrandi]] soldier. The Nona has inferior performance to the [[Queadluun-Rau]] and possesses fewer [[missile_pod|missile launchers]]. However, the Nona also features an improved dual sensor system that makes this aerospace power armor better suited for a reconnaissance role.

In [[real life]] the Queadluun-Nona was designed by artist [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 90s.

h4. See also

* [[Queadluun-Rau]]
* [[Queadluun-Rea]]

title: hydaelyn
body:
Also known as the [i]Mothercrystal[/i]. A pivotal deity in the plot of [[Final Fantasy XIV]], she shares a name with the planet it takes place on. She opposes the destructive forces of [[Zodiark (ff14)|Zodiark]] and initially appears to [[warrior of light (ff14)|players]] as a [[floating object|floating]] blue [[crystal]].

[spoiler]In the [i]Shadowbringers[/i] expansion, she is revealed to be a primal. In [i]Endwalker[/i], she faces the Scions in her true form - a [[dual persona|transformation]] of [[Venat (ff14)|Venat]]. This appearance resembles a [[giantess|giant]], ethereal woman with [[white skin|white]] or [[blue skin]], [[blue eyes]], and [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[white hair]]. She has [[multiple wings|several pairs]] of [[white wings]] including [[head wings|one on her head]], one pair of [[head fins]], and a [[halo]] ([[halo behind head|vertical]] by default). She alternates between three sets of weapons in battle, the most iconic being a blue [[sword]], which is seen in the cutscene symbolizing Venat sundering the world and features prominently in fanart.[/spoiler]

title: flip_clock
body:
A flip clock is an electric [[clock]] featuring a mechanical split-flap display, a display composed of a rotating axis which numbered flaps are attached and through rotation of the axis is able to change the number displayed on the clock face.  Also known as a "flap clock."

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flip clock":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flip_clock]

title: risoprint
body: A style inspired by a printmaking techniques that uses a Risograph machine, which creates prints in a process similar to screen printing. The most commonly used palette is hot pink and turquoise, and otherwise a muted [[neon palette]] is common. Due to being inspired by prints, it usually has a [[film grain]] texture.

title: kenshiro
body:
[b]Kenshiro[/b] ([b]ケンシロウ[/b]), or just [b]Ken[/b] as he is often called, is the central character of the [[Hokuto no Ken]] manga, anime, and other related works.

He is the 64th successor to the Hokuto Shinken art of combat, after his adopted father, Ryuken. He is considered "one of the greatest" successors in Hokuto Shinken history, due to his knowledge of certain legendary techniques like [i]Musou Tensei[/i]. He is also known for his famous catchphrase: [[you are already dead|「お前はもう死んでいる。」]] ("[i]Omae wa mou shindeiru.[/i]" / "You are already dead.")

After the nuclear war, his fiancee [[Yuria_(hokuto_no_ken)|Yuria]] was taken by [[Shin_(hokuto_no_ken)|Shin]], who defeated Kenshiro and craving the infamous seven scars on his chest. Kenshiro along with two orphanted children who later joined his cause, [[bat_(hokuto_no_ken)|Bat]] and [[Lin (hokuto no ken)|]], started his journey to taking back his fiancee from Shin. This would leading to several chains of events involving him saving the innocents from various ruthless bandits factions for their survival, and that made Kenshiro being later called as [b]"The Savior of century's end"[/b]. 

h4. Known moves

* 五指烈弾 ([i]Goshi Retsudan[/i])
** Causes the opponent's fingers to explode.

* 北斗百裂拳 ([i][[Hokuto Hyakuretsu Ken]][/i])
** Kenshiro's trademark technique, in which Ken strikes the opponent's body with a relentless flurry of punches aimed at key pressure points, resulting in full body explosion. Usually delivered with Kenshiro's famous [i]"ATATATATATATATATA"[/i] kiai.

* 二指真空把 ([i][[Nishi Shinkuu Ha]][/i])
** An arrow shot towards the user is caught between two fingers and then deflected back towards the opponent.

* 岩山両斬波 ([i][[Ganzan Ryouzan Ha]][/i])
** A hand chop which splits the opponent's skull in half.

* 北斗残悔拳 ([i][[Hokuto Zankai Ken]][/i])
** A technique that causes the opponent to explode three seconds later so he can repent for his sins before he dies.

* 北斗飛衛拳 ([i]Hokuto Hiei Ken[/i])
** A flying jump kick Kenshiro uses to defend himself against [[shin_(hokuto_no_ken)|Shin's]] [i]Nanto Gokuto Ken[/i].

* 北斗龍撃虎 ([i]Hokuto Ryuu Geki Ko[/i])
** Places the opponent in a temporary death-like coma. Ken's counterpart to [[rei (hokuto no ken)|Rei's]] [i]Nanto Ko Ha Ryuu[/i].

* 天破活殺 ([i]Tenha Kassatsu[/i])
** A powerful aura blast which strikes the opponent's vital points in the shape of the Big Dipper.

* 北斗有情猛翔破 ([i]Hokuto Ujou Moushou Ha[/i])
** An uppercut that causes opponents to die peacefully without any pain. [spoiler]Used as the finishing move to kill Souther.[/spoiler]

* 無想転生 ([i]Musou Tensei[/i])
** The ultimate secret technique of Hokuto Shinken. It makes the user untouchable to all incoming attacks.
*** [[hakurei reimu|Hakurei Reimu's]] strongest spellcard, 「夢想天生」 "Fantasy Heaven", is a homonym to this move and offers the same benefit of invulnerability.

title: captain_(honkai_impact)
body:
Captain Hyperion is the character based on the player of the game Honkai Impact 3rd. They can be male or female dependent on the player.

Does not exist in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s main world, being instead the protagonist of Captain's Bizarre Adventure, a secondary storyline (alternate world) in which they are the Captain of the heavy-class battleship Hyperion instead of [[Murata Himeko]] and travels across many bubble worlds in the Sea of Quanta.

The community usually portrays the Captain as a [[red hair|red-haired]] man with white [[military uniform]].

title: hinanectar_uniform
body:
The stage [[uniform]] worn by the members of the Holy Fruit Warriors Hinanectar (聖果戦士ヒナネクター) in [i][[Action Heroine Cheer Fruits]][/i].

The uniform consists of:
* A [[frilled capelet]] of the member's respective color.
* A [[white bowtie]] with a [[brooch]] of the member of the member's respective color.
* A [[shirt]] of the member's respective color.
* A [[white jacket]].
* Black [[elbow pads]].
* A brown [[belt]] with a decorative ornament of the member's respective color.
* A [[pleated skirt]] of the member's respective color.
* [[Black thighhighs]].
* [[White footwear|White]] [[boots]] with a border of the member's respective color.

The girls also wear [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] under their skirts to prevent panty shots on their shows. However, those are not immediately visible and are rarely seen.

h4. See also
* [[List of uniforms]]

body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Dan Heng (honkai: star rail)|]] from [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Originating from "this promotional video":[https://youtu.be/E3VyCuiyymk] which explains the real-life source of inspiration for Xianzhou architecture, the "Yi county":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_County,_Anhui].

His basic physical features are the same as in his regular outfit, meaning he has dark [[aqua eyes]] with [[red eyeliner]] only on his [[asymmetrical eyeliner|left eye]], and [[very short hair|very short]] [[black hair]] with [[hair between eyes|bangs between his eyes]].

He wears a pair of [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[under-rim eyewear|under-rim]] [[glasses]], [[mismatched earrings|mismatched]] [[earrings]]; two [[short sleeves|short-]][[layered sleeves|sleeved]] [[shirt]]s worn one [[shirt under shirt|over]] [[layered shirt|the other]] - the top one being [[two-tone shirt|two-tone]] [[green shirt|green]]-and-[[white shirt|white]] (with the larger, left side being white), and the bottom being [[black shirt|black]] and [[turtleneck]]; a [[necklace]], a [[black bag|black]] [[shoulder bag]], a set of [[multiple bracelets|bracelets]] and [[wrist straps]], and [[grey pants|grey]] [[pants]]. He might also be depicted holding a [[camera]].

h4. See also

title: fantasy_earth_zero
body:
FANTASY EARTH Zero (FEZ for short) was a MMORPG battle simulator by Enix, later Square Enix. Players would fight in large scale battles from a minimum of seven players per team to up to 50 with elements of action combat and tower defense. While initially unsuccessful on launch in 2006, the game later built up a playerbase. The last servers were shut down on September 28th 2022.

h4. Classes

title: charles_xii_of_sweden
body:
Also known as [b]Carolus Rex[/b], Charles XII (June 17, 1682 - November 30, 1718) was last king of the [[sweden|Swedish Empire]] before its downfall in the [i]Great Northern War[/i]. 

He was crowned at age 15 on the 14th of December, 1697, and ruled from April 5th, 1697 until his death on November 30th, 1718 (age 36), after which his body was carried back from [[Norway]] to Sweden by [[carolean|soldiers]] to be buried in [[Stockholm]]. 

During his reign, he launched a series of military campaigns to strengthen Sweden's control over the Baltic and as a major European power, including a disastrous invasion of [[Russia]] that eventually lead to the empire's collapse.

h4. External Links:
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_XII_of_Sweden]
* "Britannica":[https://www.britannica.com/biography/Charles-XII]

* [[carolean|Caroleans]]

title: lampiao
body:
[b]Virgulino Ferreira da Silva[/b] (b. 7 June 1897, d. 28 July 1938) better known as [b]Lampião[/b]

Notorious Brazilian bandit and leader of the cangaceiros in the Northeast. Rising to infamy in the early 20th century, engaged in audacious raids, challenging authorities and gaining both fear and admiration from locals. His blend of violence and a perceived code of justice made him a folk hero to some.

He was Killed in 1938 in a police ambush, ending an era marked by both chaos and defiance in Brazil's history, with his legacy remaining as subject of fascination and debate, embodying a complex figure whose legend persists in Brazilian culture.

title: trigger_discipline
body:
[[holding gun|Holding a gun]] while keeping one's finger away from the trigger. The opposite of [[finger on trigger]].

Characters doing so will usually have their trigger finger resting on the trigger guard or body of the [[gun|firearm]], so as to avoid an accidental trigger pull.

This tag does [i]not[/i] apply when:

* The character has their [[finger on trigger|finger on the trigger]] on inside the trigger guard.
* the character is [[holding gun|holding the gun]] by someplace other than the main grip (e.g. by the barrel or carry handle)

It is possible for someone [[dual wielding]] to practice trigger discipline with one hand and not the other, e.g. post #1188474.

h4. See also

* [[finger on trigger]]
* [[holding gun]]
* [[military operator]]

title: yawata_maru_(kancolle)
body:
The light aircraft carrier Yawata Maru as represented in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i].  Her name (八幡) means "eight flags."  Upon remodeling, her name is changed to [[Un'you (kancolle)|]]. Her illustrator is [[Shibafu_(glock23)|]], who also fleshed out sister [[Kasuga Maru (kancolle)|]]/[[Taiyou (kancolle)|]]. She was initially seen from behind on the cover of the 13-20 May 2021 issue of Weekly [[Famitsu]] magazine (post #4488154), but it was not until December 28, 2021 that she made her full reveal.

Like Kasuga Maru, Yawata Maru notably is modeled upon "classic Japanese falconry":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takagari]. She carries an [[aircraft]] (a "Mitsubishi A5M":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mitsubishi_A5M], immediate predecessor to the famous "zero" fighter) on her left forearm with [[jesses]] tied to her equipment.

Yawata Maru has [[long_hair|long]] dark [[brown hair]] tied into [[twin braids]] rolled into a [[double bun]] hairstyle and [[blunt bangs]].  She has [[brown_eyes|brown]] [[tareme]]-style eyes.  Similar to [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu's]] [[akagi (kancolle)|fleet]] [[kaga (kancolle)|carriers]], Yawata Maru wears a white [[dougi]] top with a red [[hakama short skirt]], and [[black socks|black]] [[ankle socks]].  On her left hand, she wears a thick falconry [[gloves|glove]].

Her [[machinery|rigging]] involves a [[flight deck]] strapped to her right arm, falconry-related steel pouches strapped to her torso, and steel [[platform boots]].

Historically, the [i]Yawata Maru[/i] was second of the three [i]Nitta Maru[/i] class passenger-cargo liners, but was requisitioned by the Imperial Japanese Navy and converted into a light aircraft carrier, similar to the fate of the [i][[hiyou (kancolle)|Hiyou]][/i] and [i][[jun'you (kancolle)|Jun'you]][/i].  Like Kasuga Maru before her, she resembles "her earlier anthropomorphized self on an advertisement alongside her sister-ships back in the 1940's.":[http://otakei.otakuma.net/wp/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/210.jpg]  She was never completed as a passenger liner, however, and was requisitioned and converted into a carrier before ever performing any duties as a passenger liner.

Yawata Maru spent most of her service ferrying aircraft, cargo, and passengers to various bases in the Pacific. She was badly damaged by an American submarine in early 1944. After repairs were completed in June 1944, the ship resumed transporting aircraft and cargo. During a return voyage from Singapore in September 1944, she was sunk by the submarine USS [i]Barb[/i].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Japanese aircraft carrier Un'you":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Un'y%C5%8D]
other_names: 八幡丸(艦隊これくしょん)

title: john_rambo
body:
Main protagonist of the [[Rambo]] film series based on the David Morrell novel [i]First Blood[/i]. 

[b]John Rambo[/b] is a troubled [[Vietnam War]] veteran and former U.S. Army Special Forces soldier who is skilled in many aspects of survival, weaponry, [[martial arts]] and [[guerrilla]] warfare. He has severe [[PTSD]].

Rambo is played by [[Sylvester Stallone]] in all the movies of the film series.

title: nousjadeul-ger
body:
An [[alien]] combat mecha from the [[MACROSS]] series. The [[Flemenmik]] [b]Nousjadeul-Ger[/b] is a [[Zentradi]] one-man tactical multi-role aerospace [[power armor]].

Its weapons include a powerful, long-range and shoulder mounted large beam cannon (designed for anti-ship combat), a heavy impact cannon on its torso and handled weaponry (energy guns and/or rifles).

In [[real life]] this fictional [[mecha]] was originally designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] for the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982.

It also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] anime movie from 1984 in redesigned form. The new design was created by [[Izubuchi Yutaka]]. This redesign also included a [[missile_pod|missile rack]] briefly seen on screen.

title: poseidon_(mythology)
body:
[b]Poseidon[/b] or [b]Posidon[/b] is one of the twelve Olympian deities of the pantheon in [[Greek mythology]]. His main domain is the [[ocean]], and he is called the "God of the Sea". He is usually depicted as an older male with curly hair and beard holding a [[trident]].

Infamous for his roles in creating many female monstrosity as an indirect result of his tendency to [[rape]] someone, with the victim either being cursed by the petty god into a monster (such as [[Medusa (mythology)|]] and [[Scylla]]) or seek a revenge against him.
other_names: ポセイドン(ギリシャ神話)

title: andromeda_(mythology)
body: In [[Greek mythology]], [b]Andromeda[/b] was the princess of Aethiopia. When her mother Cassiopeia boasted that Andromeda was more beautiful than the Nereids (sea nymphs), [[Poseidon (mythology)|]] sent a sea monster to destroy Aethiopia as divine punishment. Andromeda was chained to a rock by the sea as a sacrifice to the monster but was saved by the hero [[Perseus (mythology)|]].

title: wyll_(baldur's_gate)
body:
One of the eight Origin characters in [[Baldur's Gate 3]] who can either be the player character or potential party member. A male human warlock who used to be nobility in Baldur's Gate before being exile due to making a warlock's pact with a devil. However, Wyll made a name for himself across the Sword Coast as the heroic "Blade of Frontiers". Despite the Faustian origin of his strength and power, Wyll is a selfless man who puts the protection and safety of others above himself.

[spoilers]Wyll's pact holder is none other than Mizora, a powerful and manipulative cambion who uses Wyll to do her bidding. Using an intentional loophole in their contract, she sics Wyll on Karlach, due to her being the favorite of her devil superior Zariel. Should Wyll refuse or be persuaded out of doing so, Mizora will forcefully transform Wyll's appearance, causing him to grow large horns and making him look much like a devil himself.

title: wild_arms_xf
body:
The sixth installment of the [[Wild Arms]] franchise exclusively for the Playstation Portable. The 'XF' in the title is pronounced as 'Crossfire'. This is the only title to utilize a tactical RPG format, rather than traditional combat used in the earlier games. It blends in the HEX system introduced in the fourth and fifth games by allowing characters to move in any one of six spaces around them, rather than in a square. title: panzerschreck
body:
German anti-tank [[rocket launcher]] used during [[World War II]]. Developed from captured examples of the American [[M1 Bazooka]], the panzerschreck featured a larger rocket to increase both effective range and damage to the target, and a distinctive shield on the launch tube to protect the user from back blast. Like the bazooka, the panzerschreck required a two-person crew to effectively operate: one to carry and shoot the tube itself, and a loader who would carry and load the rockets.

As manpower became scarcer later in the war, the panzerschreck would be superseded by the [[panzerfaust]], which though shorter-ranged and less accurate than the panzerschreck could be loaded and fired by a single soldier. 

h4. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
other_names: パンツァーシュレック

title: panzerfaust
body:
A single shot, disposable, recoilless anti-tank weapon that was developed by Germany during World War II. Developed as a lighter, shorter range alternative to the [[panzerschreck]] that could be used by a single person rather than a two-man team, the panzerfaust weighed 6.5kg (14 lbs) and fired a High Explosive Anti-Tank (HEAT) grenade. The effective range of the weapons were initially 30 meters (33 yards) and able to penetrate 200mm (7.9") of armor. Late WWII models had a effective range of 150 meters (164 yds) and could penetrate 280mm (11") or more of armor. They were often deployed to rifle squads or volksgrenadiers, giving a single squad unparalleled tank-killing ability. Several examples of the panzerfaust were captured by the Russians towards the end of World War Two, and the panzerfaust is often credited with having inspired their rocket-propelled grenade weapons. 

Despite being intended to replace the panzerschreck, itself a derivative of the American M1 Bazooka, it should be noted that the panzerfaust and its derivative, the RPG-2, were not rocket launchers, as the projectiles they fired did not use rocket motors and the charge that was detonated to launch the grenade burned entirely within the tube at launch.  The weapon was based on those of a recoilless gun.

h4. See also

* [[Rocket launcher]]
* [[Panzerschreck]]
* [[Panzerfaust 3]]
* [[RPG (weapon)|]]
** [[RPG-7]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: rpg-7
body:
The [b]RPG-7[/b] is a 40mm caliber reusable [[rocket launcher]] of Soviet origin, designed in 1958. Being the most produced launcher in the world, it is used by various armed forces and armed groups throughout the world. Simple, rugged, and inexpensive, it consists basically of a tube with an [[optical sight]] capable of firing a variety of rocket-boosted [[ammunition|grenades]]. When loaded, the warhead protrudes from the front of the [[weapon]]. The most common projectile is the iconic high explosive anti-tank (HEAT) grenade (identifiable by its conical front section).

This tag does also apply to foreign-produced variants such as the Chinese [b]Type 69 RPG[/b] or American [b]AirTronic PSRL[/b] with more modern attachments. As well as its minor subvariants.

h4. See also
* [[RPG (weapon)|]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

title: darius_(series)
body:
[b]Darius[/b] is a series of side-scrolling shoot 'em up [[video game]]s, released by [[TAITO]]. When it started, its primary difference from other top first-generation scrolling shooters was the ability to select different levels on the way to the final areas. 

Another distinguishing characteristic is that the enemies are all based off marine life, with very few exceptions. This includes the distinct, large mecha bosses with often bizarre names. 

Many entries in the series feature an exceptionally wide screen. The games have the player control some type of [[Silver Hawk]] ship.

The series is also known for originating the boss warning in video games, its own version being a meme itself:

[quote][b]     WARNING!!
  A HUGE BATTLESHIP
   [[GREAT THING]]
 IS APPROACHING FAST[/b][/quote]

h4. See also
* [[Darius Gaiden]]

title: elevator_action_returns
body:
[b]Elevator Action Returns[/b], also known as [b]Elevator Action II[/b], is a 1994 2D run and gun [[video game]] developed for [[arcade]]s and published by [[Taito]]. 

It is the sequel to [[Elevator Action]] (1983) with a grittier, more [[realistic]] setting. It retains the elevator-based gimmick from the original, but expands the gameplay system and replaces the spy motif with a new scenario involving a paramilitary security team fighting against a [[terrorist]] group.

title: halo_behind_head
body:
A [[halo]] that's behind one's head. These halos are generally vertically-oriented, and can hang high or low behind the head if they don't encircle the entire head. Depictions of these halos can be found across religious art, such as in traditional Christian or Buddhist iconography, usually appearing as a glow of light or flames.

Do not use this tag for halos that are above one's head at an angle (ex. some depictions of [[Blue Archive]]'s halos), they have to be mostly vertical and actually behind the head or part of the background.

title: fighter_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character class for the main character. All players start the game using this class and it is the outfit [[gran_(granblue_fantasy)|Gran]] and [[djeeta_(granblue_fantasy)|Djeeta]] are most commonly depicted in for both official art and fanart.

The outfit differs depending on the character:

* Gran's outfit consists of a [[blue hoodie]] under a [[breastplate]], [[shoulder armor]] on his right arm, [[gauntlets]], [[brown pants|brown]] [[baggy pants]], and [[armored boots]].
* Djeeta's outfit consists of a [[red hairband|red]]/[[pink_hairband|pink]] [[hairband]], a [[pink_dress|pink]] [[dress]] with a [[bow]] on the front, [[shoulder armor]] on her right arm, [[gauntlets]], and brown [[thigh boots]].

title: blue_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Player character in the [[prototype design|initial drafts]] of [[Granblue Fantasy: Relink]], intended to fill the protagonist role in lieu of [[Gran (granblue fantasy)|]] and [[Djeeta (granblue fantasy)|]]. Bears a similar appearance to Djeeta, including [[blonde hair]], a [[bob cut]], [[hairband]], and [[minidress]].

Her design was shelved after deciding to characterize Gran and Djeeta in the final game, with a modified version of her outfit becoming a costume for both characters.

title: gundam_mk_v
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]].

[b]ORX-013 Gundam Mk-V[/b]

This [[mobile suit]] was designed by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]]' Augusta Research Lab as a refined version of the [[Psyco Gundam]].

One prototype was stolen by the New Desides, and was later piloted by Brave Cod in battle against the [[Ex-S Gundam]], and defeated by Ryou Roots and his AI co-pilot A.L.I.C.E.

Another Gundam Mk-V unit was given to the AEUG and assigned to [[Amuro Ray]], though there is no depiction of him piloting this mobile suit yet. Another prototype was stolen by the Axis [[Zeon]] and used as the base for the [[Doven Wolf|Döven Wolf]]; a captured Doven Wolf was then used as a testbed for the Quasi-Psycomu system and remodeled later into the [[Silver Bullet (mobile suit)]].

In [[real life]], this Gundam was designed by [[Akitaka Mika]] and debuted in the photo-novel [[Gundam Sentinel]].

title: tokusou_kihei_dorvack
body:
[b][i]Special Armored Battalion Dorvack[/i][/b] (特装機兵ドルバック, [i]Tokusō Kihei Dorubākku[/i], Cantonese: 特装機兵) is a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] anime series that aired from 1983 to 1984 in [[Japan]] and [[Hong Kong]].

There were 36 episodes produced by Ashi Productions and directed by Oniwa Hisataro. 

[[Dorvack]] is the name of a squad of mecha pilots who defend the Earth from [[alien]] invaders called the [[Idelian]]s.

The [[mecha]] designs for the show were created by Itabashi Katsumi and Habara Nobuyoshi while the models were made by the model company Gunze Sangyo. 

Other loosely translated names for the show are "Dorvack", "Dolbuk", "Special Powered Armor Troop Dorvack", "Special Machine Army Dorvack", "Machine Corps Dorvack", "Armored Trooper Dorvack", "Tokusou Kihei Dorvack", "Comando Dolbuck" ([[Brazil]]), "Dolbuk, Defensores de la Tierra" ([[Puerto Rico]]).

h4. Characters
* [[Mugen Masato]]
* [[Louise Oberon]]

h4. Variable Mecha
* [[Mugen Calibur]]
** [[calibur_(dorvack)|Calibur]]
* [[Oberon Gazzette]]
* [[Bonaparte Tulcas]]

h4.Human [[Power Armor]]s

* [[Nove]]
** [[Nove Laser]]
* [[Tinker Bell (mecha)]]

body:
A character of the series [[Jormungand (manga)|]]

[spoilers]We later learn that he is actually a spy for the CIA.[/spoilers]

Koko is voiced by [[Itou Shizuka]].

title: chinatsu_(jormungand)
body:
A character of the series [[Jormungand (manga)|]].

She is an [[assassin]] from "Orchestra", an international team of assassins which at one point had eight members. Shisho and Chinatsu are the last surviving members.

[spoilers]It is revealed that she came from a well-off family, until one day when she and her family were attending a play in an opera house, Orchestra barges in to not only kill their intended target but also mercilessly massacred all audience members. Chinatsu is the only one who survived. Though she does try to avenge the murder of her family, she only manages to wound Shisho. Shisho doesn't kill her, instead, he abducts her and trains her to be his protégé in which she developed "Stockholm Syndrome":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stockholm_syndrome] and she becomes as proficient and ruthless as Shisho.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]She is killed by Koko's team, soon after Shisho is killed in front of her.[/spoilers]

title: johnathan_mar
body:
A character of the series [[Jormungand (manga)|]]

Johnathan "Jonah" Mar, is a child soldier. He joins [[Koko_Hekmatyar|Koko]]'s crew despite his overall dislike of arms dealers and the fact that he absolutely hates guns. However, his opinions of the crew changes as he stays with them while serving as one of Koko's bodyguards.

William "Wilee" Nelson, is an explosives expert and ex-lieutenant of the 20th Engineer Brigade of the XVIII Airborne Corps in the US Army. He serves as one of [[Koko Hekmatyar]]'s bodyguards.

He is also put in charge of giving [[Johnathan Mar|Jonah]] English lessons and is the only person on the team aside from Koko to be blacklisted by the FBI.

title: karen_low
body:
A character of the series [[Jormungand (manga)|]].

[spoilers]She tries to avenge Chen after his death, but is injured by [[Johnathan Mar|Jonah]]. Homeless in [[South Africa]], she is later recruited by [[Minami Amada]] and becomes her assistant.[/spoilers]

title: minami_amada
body:
A character of the series [[Jormungand (manga)|]].

[spoiler]There is a secret plot between her and Koko, code named "Jormungand".[/spoilers]

[spoiler]She recruits [[Karen Low]] to become her assistant, after being homeless from Chen's death.[/spoilers]

title: type_99_cannon
body:
A 20mm cannon used by Japanese fighters and bombers during [[World War II]]. It is based on the Oerlikon series of autocannons which are operated by advanced primer ignition blowback.

There are two variants of the Type 99 cannon. The Type 99 Mark 1 is a light weapon but the short barrel and projectile chambered reduced the projectile range and hitting power. It is fed by a drum magazine or later, belt feed. The Type 99 Mark 2 is a heavier weapon which reduced its rate of fire but has a longer barrel and chambered for a longer projectile, making it an effective weapon against allied aircraft. Like the Type 99 Mark 1, it is fed by a drum magazine or later, belt feed.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Type 99 cannon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_99_cannon

title: type_97_chi-ha
body:
[[World War II]]-era Japanese medium [[tank]] developed in the 1930s for infantry support. The "[i]Chi[/i]" comes from "[i]chuu-sensha[/i]," meaning "medium tank," and the "[i]Ha[/i]" is derived from the third syllable of "[i]iroha[/i]," a Japanese poem form. Together this gives Chi-Ha the meaning of "third developed medium tank." 

Produced by Mitsubishi, it was armed with a 57mm cannon in an offset turret. Its armour-penetrating capabilities were low, and the tank had extremely weak armor that could be penetrated by small arms fire at close range.

Later on, the primary armament was upgraded to a 47 mm tank gun with improved armour-piercing capabilities. This improved version is often referred to by such names as the "Chi-Ha with Advanced Gun Turret," "Chi-Ha 'Kai' (Revised)," or "Type 97 Kai." However, these nicknames did not come into use until after the war.

The original Chi-Ha was equipped with a short, cylindrical gun turret and a characteristic radio [[antennae|antenna]] popularly known as a "[i][[hachimaki]][/i] antenna," while the gun turret on the Chi-Ha Kai had an angular shape.

One of the few strong points of this tank was its versatility, as a number of military machines were developed using the Chi-Ha's framework, such as the 75mm [[Type 3 Chi-Nu]] medium tank, and various self-propelled artillery, tank destroyers, and amphibious tanks (though only a very small number were produced and utilized).

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Type 97 Chi-Ha":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_97_Chi-Ha

title: type_89_i-gou
body:
Following "the Experimental Tank Number 1":[http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%A9%A6%E8%A3%BD1%E5%8F%B7%E6%88%A6%E8%BB%8A], which was the first [[tank]] to be domestically produced in Japan, the Type 89 medium tank was Japan's first domestically mass-produced tank. 

Although the experimental model completed in 1929 (year 25[b]89[/b] of the imperial dating system) was designated as a light tank, its classification soon changed to that of medium tank due to an increase in weight brought about by early modifications. 

The tank was divided into two subtypes, the Kou-gata (subtype-A), which was mounted with a water cooled gasoline engine, and the Otsu-gata (subtype-B), mounted with an air cooled diesel engine. The tank's chassis shape, undergoing repeated modifications, can broadly be divided into 4 different types. The majority types were equipped with an unditching tail (In actuality it was mostly used as a storing shelf.) 

Although the I-gou was a successful vehicle, its low horsepower and mobility prompted the development of the [[Type 95 Ha-Gou]]. It was, moreover, widely inferior to both the Soviet BT-5 and T-26 [i]light[/i] tanks used in "the battle of Khalkin Gol":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battles_of_Khalkhin_Gol and the American [[M3 Stuart]] [i]light[/i] tanks used during the invasion of the Philippines. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Type 89 I-Gou":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_89_I-Go

title: type_90_kai
body:
90式戦車改 (Type 90 Tank Kai / Kyuu-Maru-Shiki Sensha Kai) is a fictitious tank that appears in the video game series "[[Gungriffon]]." It is a modified version of the [[japan_ground_self-defense_force|JGSDF]] [[type 90 (tank)|Type 90 tank]]. As the main gun and armoring have been upgraded in the style of the [[Leopard 2]]A6, the suspension has also been modified to support the extra weight. Its fighting capability in the story is also roughly the same as the Leopard 2A6. (Apparently, at the time that the first game of the series was released in 1996, the fighting capability of the actual [[Type 90 Kyu-Maru]] was not accurately known.)

The opening intro movie of this game starts from a battle, set in 2015, between APC (Asia Pacific Corps) and PEU (Pan European Union) at Kharkiv. (The English version has a different setting.)
The two tank platoons of the APC Type 90 Kai get overwhelmingly destroyed by PEU's Leopard 3 tanks. (A fictitious mecha that has a 140 mm smoothbore gun and a new automatic turret.)
The conversation between three tank officers of the Leopard 3 after the battle is one of the most famous elements in this game.

[quote]
"90式はブリキ缶だぜ。"  (The Type 90 is a tin can!)
"だが、シベリアじゃ新型が投入されたらしい。" (But I hear a new type was introduced in Siberia.)
"新型!?" ([i]Neue panzer!?[/i] [A new tank!?])
"どうせ、たいした代物じゃないさ。" (Don't worry. It's nothing.)
[/quote]

Directly following this dialog, the tank officers' vehicle is swiftly destroyed by [[Type 12 HIGH-MACS]], which are the machines that are operated by the players. For Japanese gamers, the quote from this scene "The Type 90 is a tin can!" became the quintessential "[[death flag]]" [[meme]].

h4.See also

* Wikipedia (Japanese): "90式戦車改":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/90%E5%BC%8F%E6%88%A6%E8%BB%8A%E6%94%B9 
* Nicopedia: "90式はブリキ缶だぜ。":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4698408

title: oshiro_project:re
body:
Oshiro Project:RE, often rendered as Shiro Project:RE and abbreviated as ShiroPro:RE (城プロRE), is a mobile and browser-based tower defense game made by [[DMM]] Games. A [[Kantai Collection]]-styled game where players control "castle girls" - or moe [[personification]]s of forts/castles/historical buildings (mostly from Japan, but including some international representation).

Originally launching in November 2014 (with a title rename the month prior), the game would be temporarily closed for mechanical renewal and overhaul in April 2015. It would re-open in March 2016, with its current title, gameplay mechanics and sprites being largely overhauled, and certain girls either being removed or having had their art changed.

h4.See also

* [[List of Oshiro Project characters]]

h4.External links

* "DMM: Game Portal":[http://www.dmm.com/netgame/feature/shiropro.html]
* "Official Site":[https://oshirore-dmmgames.com/]
* "Old Official Site":http://shirocolle.jp

title: bran_(oshiro_project)
body:
A character in the game [[Oshiro Project:RE]].

Named for Bran Castle, known as [i]Castelul Bran[/i] in Romanian, [i]Törzburg[/i] in German, and [i]Törcsvár[/i] in Hungarian, situated near Bran and in the vicinity of Brașov, Romania, on the border between Transylvania and Wallachia. Commonly known as "Dracula's Castle", it is often erroneously referred to as the home of the title character in Bram Stoker's [i][[Dracula]][/i]. The first documented mention of Bran Castle was an act issued by King Louis I of Hungary (reigned 1342-1382 over Hungary and Croatia and 1370-1382 over Poland) on 19 November 1377.

title: alcazar_of_segovia_(oshiro_project)
body:
A character in the game [[Oshiro Project:RE]].

Named for The Alcázar of Segovia (literally "Segovia Fortress"), a castle located in Segovia, Spain, whose current structure dates as far back as the Berber Almoravid dynasty (1040-1147), though the first written record of it is from 1120, 32 years after the city of Segovia was returned to Christian hands under King Alfonso VI of León and Castile. The stone foundation seen today was first laid down during the reign of King Alfonso VIII (reigned 1158-1214) and his wife, Eleanor of England.

title: chateau_de_chenonceau_(oshiro_project)
body:
A character in the game [[Oshiro Project:RE]].

Named for the Château de Chenonceau, a French château spanning the River Cher, near the small village of Chenonceaux in the Indre-et-Loire [i]département[/i] of the Loire Valley in France. The estate was first mentioned in writing in the 11th century, but the current château was built in 1514-1522 on the foundations of an old mill and was later extended to span the river.

title: minakuchi_(oshiro_project)
body:
The [[Oshiro Project:RE]] counterpart of Minakuchi Castle, located in Minakuchi, Oumi Province (Kouka city, Shiga Prefecture). She is a [[ninja]] girl, probably inspired by the "Kouga-ryuu":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C5%8Dga-ry%C5%AB].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Minakuchi Castle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minakuchi_Castle

title: caernarfon_(oshiro_project)
body:
A character in the game [[Oshiro Project:RE]].

Named for Caernarfon Castle (Welsh: [i]Castell Caernarfon[/i]), also anglicized as Carnarvon Castle, located in Caernarfon, Gwynedd, northwest Wales. There was a motte-and-bailey castle in the town from the late 11th century until 1283 when King Edward I of England (reigned 1272-1307) began replacing it with the current stone structure. It was used for the investiture of the Prince of Wales in 1911 (Edward, later Edward VIII, son of George V) and 1969 (Charles, son of Elizabeth II).

title: carcasonne_(oshiro_project)
body:
A character in the game [[Oshiro Project:RE]].

Named for both the fortified city of Carcassonne, France, which due to its strategic location led the Roman Empire and successive rulers to expand its fortifications until the Treaty of the Pyrenees (1659), and the Cité de Carcassonne, a medieval fortress restored by theorist and architect Eugène Viollet-le-Duc in 1853.

title: aizuwakamatsu_(oshiro_project)
body:
A character in the game [[Oshiro Project:RE]].

Named for Aizuwakamatsu Castle (会津若松城, [i]Aizu-Wakamatsu-jō[/i]), also known as Tsuruga Castle (鶴ヶ城, [i]Tsuru-ga-jō[/i]), at the centre of Aizuwakamatsu, Fukushima Prefecture, which was constructed in 1384 by Ashina Naomori, its name originally Kurokawa Castle (黒川城), and demolished in 1874. The [i]tenshu[/i], the largest tower of the castle, was reconstructed in 1965.

title: akashi_(oshiro_project)

Named for Akashi Castle (明石城, [i]Akashi-jō[/i]) located in Akashi, Hyōgo Prefecture, which was constructed by Ogasawara Tadazane between 1617 and 1619 and then demolished in 1874.

body:
A character in the game [[Oshiro Project:RE]].

Named for Aoba Castle (青葉城, Aoba-jō), also known as Sendai-jō (仙台城) and Gojō-rō (五城楼), located in Sendai, Miyagi Prefecture, which was constructed in 1601 by [[Date Masamune]]. The castle was destroyed repeatedly by earthquakes and fires over the centuries, most notably in the years 1616, 1648, 1668, and 1710. It was partially dismantled in the 1870s and a large fire in 1882 destroyed much of the remaining structure.

title: self-balancing_scooter
body:
A narrow horizontal board with wheels at each end, on which a person may stand upright and move by leaning forwards. Also known as a hoverboard, self-balancing board, or Segway.

These devices should not be tagged [[scooter]] or [[hoverboard]], as those refer to different devices.

h4. See also

* [[Segway]]

title: hover_bike
body:
A type of [[motor_vehicle|motorized vehicle]] that can fly in the air and resembles a single- or two-person [[motorcycle|motor bike]]. Popular in [[science fiction]] stories.

h4. See Also

* [[Hoverboard]]
* [[Hover scooter]]

title: flyboard
body:
A hydroflighting device where the rider stands on a board connected by a long hose to a watercraft. Water is forced under pressure to a pair of boots with jet nozzles underneath which provide thrust for the rider to fly up to 22 m (72 ft) in the air.  Invented by Zapata Racing in 2012.

A similar hydroflight device named a hoverboard utilizes a single water jet for propulsion.

Should not be confused with the sci-fi device [[hoverboard]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hydroflight sports":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydroflight_sports]

title: hoverboard
body:
A [[skateboard]] or [[surfboard]]-like sci-fi or fantasy device that utilizes some means of levitation to allow it to either fly or hover above the ground.   Hover boards were first described by author M. K. Joseph in a 1967 science fiction novel, and popularized by the [[Back to the Future]] film franchise.

Should not be confused with [[self-balancing scooter]]s, which some companies have taken the term hoverboard to refer to their products.

h4. See also

* [[flyboard]]
* [[snowboard]]

title: sonic_boom_(series)
body:
[b]Sonic Boom[/b], also known as [b]Sonic Toon[/b] (ソニックトゥーン [i]Sonikku Tūn[/i]) in Japan, is a spin-off franchise of the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]] with a more comedic approach and new character redesigns, which consists of video games, TV and comic series.

The TV series' first season aired on Cartoon Network on November 8th, 2014, and a second season aired on Boomerang on October 29, 2016 with the season finale airing on November 11, 2017.

h4. Games
* Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric (2014, Wii U)
* Sonic Boom: Shattered Crystal (2014, 3DS)
* Sonic Dash 2: Sonic Boom (2015, mobile)
* Sonic Boom: Fire & Ice (2016, 3DS)

title: kaban_(kemono_friends)
body:
The protagonist of the first [[Kemono Friends]] anime. She never appeared in the game or the manga adaptation. Voiced by [[Uchida Aya]].  

As she doesn't know who (or what) she is, she is named after the [[backpack]] that she wears, with her name literally meaning [[bag]].

She wears a tattered [[pith helmet]] with a [[hat feather|feather]] in it over her [[short hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] [[wavy hair]] that comes down [[hair between eyes|between her]] [[black eyes]]. Her clothing includes a [[red shirt]], [[shorts]], [[black_pantyhose]] and [[black gloves]].

[spoilers]She is, in fact, a human "Friend" i.e a recreation of a human specimen in a similar manner to how "Friends" in Japari Park were created based on the DNA samples of various animals.[/spoilers]

title: parks_and_recreation
body:
[b]Parks and Recreation[/b] (also known as Parks and Rec) is a American mockumentary sitcom that aired on NBC for seven seasons from April 9, 2009, to February 24, 2015.

The series focuses on the employees of the Parks and Recreation Department of the fictional town of Pawnee, Indiana where the characters try to do their job while dealing with bureaucractic red tape and other problems.

title: analog_clock
body:
A type of [[clock]] normally consisting of [[dial|a circular face with 12 numbers]], one for each hour in an AM/PM system, a short hand indicating the hour, and a long hand indicating the minute. Minutes are grouped into batches of 5, though sometimes there may be smaller lines between the hour markers for each minute interval. May or may not contain an additional hand indicating the seconds.

Certain unique types of analog clocks may have greater or fewer than 12 hours, though 12 is the most common.

title: dial
body:
A circular object that usually has series of numbers. Commonly seen on [[analog clock]]s, [[gauge|measuring instruments]], [[speedometer]]s, etc. Old clocks may also have [[roman numeral]]s.

body:

Sometimes referred to as "Monoeyes".

title: kanbaru_suruga
body:
A [[Monogatari (series)|Monogatari series]] character, Kanbaru Suruga has (typically) [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[thick eyebrows]], and [[brown eyes]] (though she wore her hair as [[long_hair|long]], [[low twintails]] in [[Hanamonogatari]]). She often wears a [[Naoetsu High School Uniform]] with a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[shirt]] with [[juliet sleeves]], a [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[purple skirt|purple]] [[pleated skirt]] (over [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]]), [[black socks|black]] [[ankle socks]] and [[white footwear|white]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[high tops|high top]] [[sneakers]] as [[shoes]].  She almost always has a [[bandages|bandaged]] left [[bandaged arm|arm]].

She is a typical [[tomboy]] and ace of the [[basketball]] team. She's an admitted [[yuri|lesbian]], [[fujoshi]], [[nude|nudist]] / [[exhibitionism|exhibitionist]], lolicon and [[masochism|masochist]]. She is the daughter of [[Gaen Tooe]] and niece of [[Gaen Izuko]].

h4.See also

* "Bakemonogatari Wikia":http://bakemonogatari.wikia.com/wiki/Suruga_Kanbaru
* "Nicopedia":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4137037

body:
[[Five-seveN (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'The Young Girls and the Sea' skin collection from 2017.

It is a [[swimsuit]] skin that show off her [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[black bikini]], with a [[halterneck]] [[front-tie bikini top]] and [[multi-strapped bikini bottom|multi-strapped]], [[side-tie bikini bottom|side-tied]], [[lowleg bikini|lowleg bikini bottom]], with a visible [[strap gap]]. Paired with her bikini, she wears [[fake animal ears]] in the form of a [[rabbit hair ornament|black rabbit hair ornament]], a [[detached collar|white detached collar]] and [[black bow]] in a callback to her base attire, her usual [[diamond hair ornament|black diamond hair ornament]]s and [[single earring|single]] [[crescent earrings|crescent earring]], a [[thigh strap]] with a [[thigh ribbon|ribbon]], and [[high heels|high heel]] [[sandals]].

title: iceberg
body:
Large pieces of ice that broke off [[glacier]]s and flow freely in the sea. Icebergs vary widely in size and shape, though are iconically portrayed as floating mountains of ice.

Due to the buoyancy properties of ice, only 10% of an entire iceberg is visible above water while the remaining 90% is hidden underwater.

h4. See also

* [[Glacier]]
* [[Ice floe]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article:Iceberg":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iceberg]

title: ice_floe
body:
Floating sheets or pieces of ice that aren't attached to any landmass and freely drifts in the sea.

As opposed to [[iceberg]]s which originate on land as part of [[glacier]]s, ice floes form in the sea as frozen sea water. Their sizes can vary and overlap with each other, but as far as tagging is concerned, ice floe generally refers to smaller pieces of ice often seen floating together in fields.

h4. See also

* [[Glacier]]
* [[Iceberg]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article: Ice floe":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ice_floe]

title: flyer
body: A piece of [[paper]] with an information about certain products, services, or event. It was intended as a cheap form of [[ad]]vertisements and typically handed to strangers to promote the subject.

title: glacier
body:
Large, persistent masses of ice that has formed on land over many years or centuries and is constantly moving under its own weight. The largest glaciers can span entire continents and are called continental glaciers or ice sheets, such as the one that covers the entirety of [[Antarctica]].

[[Iceberg]]s are pieces of glaciers that have broken off into the sea and float freely.

h4. See also

* [[Iceberg]]
* [[Ice floe]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article:Ice flow":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ice_floe]

title: wreck-it_ralph
body:
2012 computer-animated movie, produced by Disney. The story focuses around the titular character, [[Wreck-It Ralph (character)|Wreck-It Ralph]], a video game villain who is tired of his job and jumps to other video games in order to be a hero instead.

A sequel was released in 2018, titled [i]Ralph Breaks the Internet[/i], in which Ralph travels to the Internet to get a new steering wheel part for the [i]Sugar Rush[/i] arcade game, after the one on the machine breaks.

h4. Characters

* [[Wreck-It Ralph (character)|Wreck-It Ralph]]

* [[Tamora Jean Calhoun]]
* [[Taffyta Muttonfudge]]

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wreck-It_Ralph

title: antarctica
body:
The southernmost continent on [[Earth (planet)|]], containing the geographic South Pole and being mostly covered by the Antarctic ice sheet, a continental [[glacier]]. Antarctica is the coldest and least populated continent by humans, though known to be inhabited by [[penguin]]s and [[seal (animal)|]]s.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article:Antarctica":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antarctica]

title: amatsuka_uto
body:
[b]Amatsuka Uto[/b] (天使うと) is an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber]]. Designed by [[Nabi (uz02)|]] and rigged by [[takeka fungi]].

On April 6th, 2023, she announced that she would be "suspending all her activities after April 25th,":[https://twitter.com/amatsukauto/status/1643945953165185024] with her indefinite hiatus beginning on the 30th. While initially planning to retire from VTubing in the months after her hiatus, she was scouted by [[VOICE-ORE]] in December 2023 and unsuspended her activities.

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #4255117 for default and post #4581208 for second outfit.[/tn]

She has [[blue eyes]], [[small breasts]], and long [[blue hair]] with two small [[twintails]] tied up by [[angel wings]], a pair of silver [[hairclip]]s on her right side and a curling [[ahoge]] around her head resembling a [[halo]]. Her clothes consist of a layered white and blue flowing [[halter dress]] decorated with various [[ribbon]]s and [[detached sleeves]] that cover her hands.

h4. External links
* "YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdYR5Oyz8Q4g0ZmB4PkTD7g
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/amatsukauto

title: ina_uruu
body:
[[Virtual youtuber]] for [[Nanashi Inc.]], part of the first group after the internal merger. Terminated on December 20th 2023 after disappearing.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[purple hair|purple]] and [[pink hair]] in [[low twintails]] held with [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]]s, a [[mini crown]], and a [[black ribbon]] [[ear ribbon|around]] her [[cat ears]], and [[pink eyes]]. Her outfit is a [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt|crop]] [[crop top|top]] [[criss-cross halter|connected]] to a [[black collar|black]] [[detached collar]], showing her [[cleavage]] of her [[medium breasts]], [[midriff]], ,and [[navel]]. Her [[detached sleeves]] are [[black sleeves|black]] with a [[two-tone bow|two-tone]] [[white bow|white]] and [[black bow]], as the same on her [[bow skirt]], which is [[black skirt|black]] and [[lace-trimmed skirt|trimmed with lace]]. On her legs is a [[thigh strap]] and a [[single sock|single]] [[black socks|black sock]] with [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

h4. External Links
* "Youtube":[https://www.youtube.com/@Uruu_Ina]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Uruu_Ina]
